Went to Canada with Kevin!!! Good times, bad times, crazy times, stressful times.
Heres how it went.

Yay for Canada!
Yay for making through customs!
Yay for the pretty drive up there!
Yay for 6 bars in one!
Yay for HUGE beds!
Yay for falling alseep on someone you loves lap!
Yay for big pretty castles!
Yay for fun pictures!
Yay for shopping downtown!
Yay for smokey hotel rooms!
Yay for Tiffany being old enough to buy a bottle of gin!
Yay for drinking the whole bottle of gin!
Yay for pretty ferrie rides!
Yay for getting Kevin home in time for his first show!
Yay for fun songs!

Boo for customs and licenses!
Boo for ghetto hotels!
Boo for fighting with Kevin every 5 minutes!
Boo for evil maids!
Boo for crying at dinner!
Boo for bad thoughts!
Boo for not getting our deposit back!
Boo for all the rain!
Boo for FUCKING MISSING THE FERRY!
Boo for speeding tickets!
Boo for no cigarettes!
Boo for yelling at Kevin!
Boo for Kevin wanting to pull my hair out!
Boo for traffic!

Yay overall for the trip
And an amazingly high YAY FOR GETTING MY LIFE BACK AND GETTING OVER A CERTAIN BUTTON
Which makes this trip a success.
-T

IRONYS A BITCH

AAAHAHAHA Well...Anyone that knows me personaly will find this highly amusing.

So I was in my car last night on the way to get food with Kevin at like 1am. The only CD's I had in my car were JC Chazes and Maria's Arcade (his band). After listening to JC for a bit I knew it was drving Kev crazy. So I tell him
"I'd change the CD but the only other thing I have in my car is your band...and you DON'T want to hear me singing to that at the top of my lungs!"
Well he then says that he's never heard anybody sing his songs before so I put the CD in.
And Im off being cheesy and singing at the top of my lungs.
In the middle of this I notice him watching me. So I look over at him and he tell me that I sound good and that I should sing with him. I laugh it off, because I've heard me in the shower singing and Im no good...I sound like poo....Anyone that has ever been in my car will agree with this!
Somehow or another he decides that I need to sing with him at his show on Monday...
RIIIIIIIIIIIIIGHT This is rediculous for the following reasons:
1. I can't sing
2. I dont sing
3. I CAN'T SING!

Well long story short...Me being madly in love with him, AGREES to do it. So now I'm practicing with him on Sunday so we can perfect my perfect litle song
So I can sing with him at his show on Monday. HAHAHHA

WHAT THE FUCK HAVE I GOTTEN MYSELF INTO?

THESE MAKE ME PONDER...

Every day more money is printed for Monopoly than the US Treasury

The glue on Israeli postage stamps is certified kosher.

Mel Blanc (the voice of Bugs Bunny) was allergic to carrots.

Dr. Seuss pronounced "Seuss" such that it rhymed with "rejoice."

All of the clocks in the movie Pulp Fiction are stuck on 4:20

In Casablanca, Humphrey Bogart never said "Play it again, Sam."

Sherlock Holmes never said "Elementary, my dear Watson."

More people are killed annually by donkeys than die in air crashes

Money isn't made out of paper, it's made out of cotton.

The average American makes six trips to the bathroom every day-that's about 2 1/2 years of your life. 

The name Wendy was invented for Peter Pan, no one before the story had the name Wendy

Right handed people live on average 7 years longer than left handed people

American Airlines saved 40,000 dollars in one year just from eliminating an olive off of the salads in first class!

101 Dalmations and Peter Pan are the only two Disney cartoon features with both parents who are presentand don't die throughout the movie

The average cough comes out of your mouth at 60MPH

When the Titanic sunk there was 7,500 lbs of ham on it

13 people each year are killed by Vending Machine's falling on them

The average human produces 25,000 quarts of spit in a lifetime, enough to fill two swimming pools

A can of SPAM is opened every 4 seconds

Coca-Cola was originally green.

The only food that doesnt EVER spoil is honey

Al Capone's business card said he was a used furniture dealer.

Sylvia Miles had the shortest performance ever nominated for an Oscar with Midnight Cowboy. Her entire role lasted only six minutes. 

The numbers '172' can be found on the back of the U.S. $5 dollar bill in the bushes at the base of the Lincoln Memorial. 

Celery has negative calories! It takes more calories to eat a piece of celery than the celery has in it to begin with
